bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman
bibl.title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [21 April 1873]
bibl.orgName: The Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, Duke University Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library

revisionDesc.change: Annotate Louisa's dream house; George's house, marginal inscriptions, extended cancelled passage, postscript on first page
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)
Encode regularization of contractions, days of week, and frequently misspelled words

body.p: i thought i would write to you to day as i dident didn't know what to doo do with myself i dident didn't hardly expect a letter to day as i got one saturdaySaturday we have just had our dinner after waiting for georgeGeorge 2 or 3 hours we had a peice piece of beef yesterday and had it again to day and shall have it till wensday Wednesday or thursday Thursday sometime we have a good peice piece then it aint ain't so bad to have it last so long but this peice piece is not very good Lou sends orders and eddEddy goes the errands she is down stairs now gets up to breakfast when we are nearly over walke around and lays on the sofa yesterday she went up to the lot to see it georgeGeorge and she it was as much as she could doo do she said i dont don't know whether she will make out any thing or not

i get very much annoyed sometim and very nerviousnervous little things affects me more than it does some people i think since her aunt is here she could dispence dispense with me very easily) the other day Lou was saying how much butter we used in a week and it was so dear she said she was shure sure aunt libbyLibby dident didn't eat much butter i said dont don't get any butter when its it's so high) i dont don't think eddEdd and i together eats a quarter of a pound in a week he dont don't get it to eat

the aunty is helpet helped to the best and the largest sometime i feel bad enoughf enough if i was younger i should show some of my dignity now waltWalt write to me to morrow and tell me how you are getting along waltWalt if you think you cant can't get a house for us to live in dont don't worry about me i shall live my allotted time) if you ever do get one i think one about the size of what i wrote about would do and wouldent wouldn't cost very much with a cellar under the 2 rooms and not under the shed kichen kitchen
but walterWalter dear if you was only well how glad i would be and i gess guess you would be as glad as i
